title: POP to IMAP saving old messages
content: I recently converted from POP to IMAP. It appears old messages from POP were automatically migrated to the IMAP Local Folder, but how can I confirm that before I remove the old POP account? The conversion instructions said I needed to manually move the old messages, but they are already in the Local Folder.
creator: cfnord

title: Thunderbird 115.9.0-1 Snap will not open hyperlinks in messages
content:
Hello!

My Thunderbird snap was updated a few days ago to 115.9.0-1. Since then, I cannot open any hyperlinks in any messages. I am running Ubuntu 20.04 LTS. Opening hyperlinks in emails was working fine prior to the upgrade.

As far as I can tell from the TB settings, TB is set up to "Use System Handler (default)" for "HTML document". I can set the system browser to Chrome or FireFox, but the problem still persists. Hyperlinks open from other documents, like LibreOffice documents.

The console logs the following error whenever a hyperlink is clicked: NS_ERROR_FAILURE: Component returned failure code: 0x80004005 (NS_ERROR_FAILURE) [nsIHandlerInfo.launchWithURI] ContentDispatchChooser.sys.mjs:76

Any ideas?

My TB Snap info is: jhuber@t5610:~$ snap info thunderbird name: thunderbird summary: Mozilla Thunderbird email application publisher: Canonical✓ store-url: https://snapcraft.io/thunderbird contact: https://launchpad.net/distros/ubuntu/+source/thunderbird license: unset description: | 

 Thunderbird is a free and open source email, newsfeed, chat, and calendaring client, that’s easy  to set up and customize. One of the core principles of Thunderbird is the use and promotion of  open standards - this focus is a rejection of our world of closed platforms and services that  can’t communicate with each other. We want our users to have freedom and choice in how they  communicate.

commands: 

 - thunderbird

snap-id: k1Ml1O9GzSO2QftV0ZlWSbUfQ78nN460 tracking: latest/stable refresh-date: 5 days ago, at 09:41 CDT channels: 

 latest/stable:    115.9.0-1 2024-03-20 (460) 145MB -  latest/candidate: 124.0-1   2024-03-13 (459) 150MB -  latest/beta:      124.0b5-1 2024-03-12 (456) 150MB -  latest/edge:      ↑

installed: 115.9.0-1 (460) 145MB -

title: Color texto en mensajes
content:
Buenos días, cuando redacto un nuevo mensaje de correo electrónico y quiero colorear el texto en una frase, solo se colorea la primera palabra pero si selecciono un párrafo con más de una línea, pasa lo mismo solo se colorea una palabra por línea pero distintas palabras en una misma línea no se colorea.

La versión de mi ThunderBird es 115.9.0 (64 bit) sobre un Windows 10 Pro.

No sé si faltaría algún dato para poder ayudarme.

Gracias de antemano.

Saludos,

Carlos.

title: Thunderbird no longer loading messages prefixed as ***SPAM***
content: Up until a few weeks ago around 70% of my messages were prefixed ***SPAM*** even though most were not. This was not a problem, as I looked at the subject and sender and decided for myself. I now get no messages prefixed ***SPAM***, I can however, get these with webmail. I did not change any settings, this just happened. I have tried playing with the security spam settings but this does not fix the problem. My computer runs Linux Fedora, always the latest version. Any help/suggestions greatly appreciated. Cheers Steve
creator: steve611

title: Emails sent by moodle or webmails are not shown in sent folder
content:
Hello everyone,

At work we have a moodle installation that uses an email account to send messages, notifications, etc to students. In the past we used gmail and we saw how every email Moodle sent was in the "Sent" folder. Now we switched to a custom email account from our hosting and since we did that we cannot see the emails Moodle sent. I decided to try Thunderbird to see if I could see it there but I still can't. I checked the option "Copy in Other" so it saves the email in the Sent folder. It works when I send an email directly from Thunderbird but not if I send an email from webmail or Moodle.

Any idea of why this is happening?

Thanks in advance!
creator: daniel.garcia

title: Error envío email de cuentas HOTMAIL
content:
Buenas tardes.

Llevo años con este gestor de cuentas de email, y todo perfecto.

Pero desde hace una semana no me deja enviar emails, solo recibo emails para cuentas "hotmail".

El resto de cuentas de email corporativas van perfectas.

Me da este error al intentar enviar emails desde 2 cuentas de HOTMAIL:

Falló el envío del mensaje. El mensaje no se ha podido enviar porque ha caducado la conexión al servidor de salida (SMTP) smtp.office365.com. Vuelva a intentarlo.

Muchas gracias anticipadas por los comentarios.

content:
POzdravljeni

Pred nekaj dnevi smo si uredili ExpressVPN, naš poštni odjemalec je Thunderbird na katerem imam nastavljenih več email računov in sicer gmail, domenske poštne predale, problem pa je pri poštnem predalu siol.net, če imam vklopljen VPN , mi niti ne sprejema , niti pošilja pošte s tega poštnega predala, če VPN izklopim, pošta poteka normalno. title: Compacting folders on 102.11.0 (64 bit)
content:
After a recent upgrade of Thunderbird I started getting pop-ups about compacting folders. This was not unusual, but it now pops up every couple of hours and states it will recover 6.4 GB of disk space. No matter how many times I do this (click on compact now). It keeps coming up with the same size disk savings. This has been going on for over a month. Even the many times it has been rebooted this behavior does not change.

Is there something that is being detected that is not getting compacted? Is it usual for this to happen so frequently? How do I handle this so it does not keep doing the same thing?

It's driving me nuts.
creator: JustMe3

title: Autostart Thunderbird with Windows
content: How do I get 115.9.0 to autostart with windows? I did have this working, so i know it's possible, but reinstalled at someone's suggestion to cure another problem and it no longer does. I thought I got it to work before by adding it to shell:startup, but this isn't working now and neither is putting it in shell:common startup. It doesn't appear under Settings/Apps/Startup or in Hibit Startup Manager, but is shown as Enabled in Task Manager/Startup. I used to be able to get it to work with a Startup Manager in jv!6 Powertools, but they seem to have removed this option. Glary Utilities Startup Manager lists Thunderbird, but as Disabled, with no option to Enable it.

title: Ripristino messaggi in "Tutti i messaggi"
content: Utilizzo su MacOS 14.4.1 il client Thunderbird 115.9 in modalità IMAP. Ho stupidamente cancellato in 'Tutti i messaggi' i messaggi antecedenti l'1/01/2024, che sono stati cancellati anche da tutti i folder in cui avevo salvati molti di loro. In un altro Mac, subito sconnesso dalla rete, ho eseguito l'export del profilo Thunderbird in un file ZIP di circa 12GB. Non posso eseguire l'import di questo file perchè >2GB. Navigando nel disco del secondo Mac ho recuperato i file 'Tutti i messaggi' (900 MB) e 'Tutti i messaggi.msf' (1.5 MB). È possibile in qualche modo ripristinare in contenuto del folder con quanto ho recuperato? Moltissime grazie.
creator: Juna55

title: Thunderbird "reset" itself and now email folders missing.
content:
Am trying to resolve an issue for a client. They are a longtime Thunderbird user and several days ago when they opened the program it seemed to have forgotten who they were. Unsure whether that's because of a Thunderbird update or just something randomly corrupted.

In any case they tried to re-enter their account information (POP3 by the way) but had some issues getting the settings right. I got them straightened around with the proper ports and settings this morning so they are able to send and receive email however all of the folders which she previously had in her inbox are no longer there. I did check the server for folders just on the off chance that they had been using IMAP and not POP3, but none were found.

In checking their Thunderbird profile folder (there is only the one) by timestamps it was created many years back but by current date stamps on the Inbox files it is where the current new mail is being downloaded to.

Their folder list within Thunderbird itself is pretty barren... Inbox, Sent and Trash

If I look in the profile folder on the other hand I do see an "inbox.sbd" (dated about a week ago) and it does appear to contain all of the files and sub-folders related to the missing folders so the data is obviously there in some form. How do I get it "re-linked" into Thunderbird so the user can access it?

Thanks Mike
creator: mcisar
